intro: Chabrea carvifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved chabrea, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It features slender, upright stems that bear small, lance-shaped leaves with a distinctive silvery-white underside. The plant produces clusters of tiny, pale blue or purple flowers during the spring and summer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and dry landscapes. Due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits, it is often cultivated in horticultural settings.
